description: From Late Latin indomitābilis, from in- (“not”) + domitō, frequentative of domō (“to tame”).

adjectives.description: indomitable (comparative more indomitable, superlative most indomitable)

entries.meaning: Incapable of being subdued, overcome, or vanquished.
examples: Personal courage and an indomitable self-confidence were the chief, indeed the only, qualities which sprang to light in General Feversham.
